alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 3:29PM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOW COMING TO AN END... .One final band of moderate to heavy snow is sinking south out of the mountains. While only an additional inch or two of snowfall is possible, visibility may drop to 1/2 to 1/4 mile again and create hazardous driving conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches for a storm total of 7 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...A period of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
